issue.title: ECIP-1000: Hidden Censorhip
issue.body:
**Issue:** 
The creator of an issue or PR can, **unknowingly to other owners**, censor comments and other actions from any user he wishes by blocking the user from his personal account. This will block the user from participating in his PRs or issues.

**Why:**
This is in direct violation of ECIP-1000:

> Will ECIP comments be censored or limited to particular participants/"experts"?
> 
> Participants should freely refrain from commenting outside of their area of knowledge or expertise. However, comments should not be censored, and participation should be open to the public.

**Proof:**
Example, this is how I see the "Code of Conduct" PR (how ironic..) where I'm unable to comment.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30156189/70189390-1c87aa00-16eb-11ea-9978-a7144a71d5ca.png)

And before someone comes up with a crazy story like "deleted the repo owners by accident", this is also not an accidental consequence of a personal feud or whatever one might call it. This is very clear and likely the only reason for such block, as per githubs description prior to blocking.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30156189/70189783-1b0ab180-16ec-11ea-8dab-3475ed29efe5.png)

At this point I feel there's a 50/50 chance that I will get banned from this github organization as a whole for voicing abuses but I can assure you, once again, I will not be easily censored. All it takes is another github account.

@bobsummerwill you weirdly messaged me the other day, saying you "run the show" in ETC
Coop

Is this how you show it? 
Note taken.
